mech.mania.API

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • mech.mania.API.GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to store the state of the game. Created to be deserialized from the game state JSON object.

    • Method Detail

      • pathTo

        public Direction[] pathTo(Position start,
                          Position end,
                          Position[] tilesToAvoid)
        Helper method to return shortest path from start to end avoiding locations in tilesToAvoid. Returns null if impossible.
        Parameters:
        start - The Position to start from.
        end - The desired end Position.
        tilesToAvoid - An array of Positions to avoid in the path.
        Returns:
        An array of Direction objects indicating the path from start to end.

      • pathTo

        public Direction[] pathTo(Position start,
                          Position end)
        Same as pathTo(Position, Position, Position[]) with tilesToAvoid defaulted to an empty array.
        See Also:
        pathTo(Position, Position, Position[])

      • getPositionsOfAttackPattern

        public java.util.List<Pair<Position,java.lang.Integer>> getPositionsOfAttackPattern(Position unitPosition,
                                                                                    int[][] attackPattern,
                                                                                    Direction dir)
        Helper method to return what damage would be done at what locations for a hypothetical attack.
        Parameters:
        unitPosition - The Position from which the attack would be fired.
        attackPattern - The attack pattern with which the attack would be fired.
        dir - The Direction the attack would be fired in.
        Returns:
        A list of Pairs of (Position, Integer) indicating how much damage would be done at certain locations if a unit with attackPattern were to attack in Direction dir. from position unitPosition. Positions returned are absolute, not relative to unitPosition. Returns null if attackPattern is invalid.

      • getPositionsOfAttackPattern

        public java.util.List<Pair<Position,java.lang.Integer>> getPositionsOfAttackPattern(int unitId,
                                                                                    Direction dir)
        Same as getPositionsOfAttackPattern(Position, int[][], Direction) with unitPosition defaulted to the specified unit's position and attackPattern defaulted to the specified unit's attack pattern.
        See Also:
        getPositionsOfAttackPattern(Position, int[][], Direction)

      • getPositionAfterMovement

        public Position getPositionAfterMovement(Position start,
                                         Direction[] movementSteps)
        Helper method to return the new absolute position given an initial position and a set of movement steps. Does NOT account for any map conditions. This means it can return a position where terrain or another unit exists, and it can also return a position which is outside of the game map.
        Parameters:
        start - Position to start from.
        movementSteps - Array of Directions indicating movement steps to take.
        Returns:
        The final absolute Position obtained from beginning at start and moving according to movementSteps irrespective of the current game's map.

      • isDecisionValid

        public boolean isDecisionValid(Decision decision,
                               int unitId)
        Helper method to indicate if an Decision object is valid.
        Parameters:
        decision - The Decision to evaluate.
        unitId - The unitId of the Unit for which this Decision should be evaluated.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing the validity of the Decision.

      • isUnitSetupValid

        public boolean isUnitSetupValid(UnitSetup setup)
        Helper method to indicate if a UnitSetup object is valid.
        Parameters:
        setup - The UnitSetup to evaluate.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing the validity of the Decision.

      • isAttackPatternValid

        public boolean isAttackPatternValid(int[][] attackPattern)
        Helper method to indicate if an attackPattern is valid.
        Parameters:
        attackPattern - 2D array of integers representing an attack pattern.
        Returns:
        True if attackPattern is valid, false otherwise.

      • isTerrainPatternValid

        public boolean isTerrainPatternValid(boolean[][] terrainPattern)
        Helper method to indicate if a terrainPattern is valid.
        Parameters:
        terrainPattern - 2D array of integers representing an attack pattern.
        Returns:
        True if terrainPattern is valid, false otherwise.
